title: Quiz 5: Execution, Analysis & Presentation
description: Test your knowledge on data collection, cleaning, analysis, and graphical presentation methods.

questions.question: Order the stages of survey execution:
questions.hint: You collect it, store it, then analyze it.

questions.question: What should an interviewer do if a respondent refuses to cooperate?

options.text: Politely thank the person and proceed to the next interview.
Force them to answer as it is a government requirement.
Fill the form themselves based on guessing.
Argue with them until they agree.

questions.explanation: Respondents have the right to refuse. Respect their decision politely.

questions.question: Interviewers should use ink pens to fill questionnaires so the data cannot be erased.
questions.explanation: They should use PENCIL to allow for neat corrections (crossing out and rewriting) without making the form messy.
questions.hint: What if they make a mistake?

questions.question: What is involved in 'Data Cleaning'?
questions.explanation: Data cleaning involves fixing errors and gaps before analysis begins. Graphing is presentation.

questions.question: In tallying, a cluster usually consists of four vertical strokes with a ___BLANK___ stroke drawn through them.
questions.explanation: Four vertical + one slanting = 5. This makes counting easier.
questions.hint: The stroke that ties the bundle.

questions.question: Match the graph type to its description:

pairs.right: Vertical blocks touching each other; for continuous data.
Spaced rectangles; can be vertical or horizontal.
Circle divided into sectors showing percentages.
Line graph joining midpoints of histogram bars.

questions.explanation: Histograms touch (continuous); Bar charts have spaces (categorical). Pie charts show parts of a whole.

questions.question: What does a straight horizontal line on a graph indicate?

options.text: There has been no change in the aspect being measured.
There has been a rapid increase.

questions.explanation: A horizontal line means the value remains constant over time.

questions.question: What is the term for data that has been sorted or arranged into some order (e.g., ascending magnitude)?
questions.explanation: An array is data arranged in order of magnitude.

questions.question: Ideally, the sectors of a Pie Chart should not exceed how many components?
questions.explanation: Too many sectors make a pie chart hard to read. Seven is a recommended maximum.

questions.question: What is 'Coding' in the context of data analysis?

options.text: Converting data into numerical codes for analysis.

questions.explanation: Coding involves assigning numbers (codes) to responses (e.g., Yes=1, No=0) to facilitate calculation.
